1.Vladimir is on the extended "toxic game design, needs to be reworked" backlog list somewhere, so its not like he's actually an example of Rito-hypocrisy or something, but.....

2.Vladimir is actually a different design from Zilean in ways that make it less toxic to have a point&click damage skill.  To list them:

A)Old-Zilean could do 640 base damage plus 1.8 AP worth of damage of targeted damage as pure burst from 700 range in .25s.  Vladimir's Q 230 base and .6 AP worth of damage at 600 range.  At level 9.  One of these things is not like the other, man.

B)Targeted spells become more toxic with range and less toxic with game time.  A targeted nuke in a teamfight is *WAY* less toxic than a proportionally relevant targeted nuke in the laning phase.  This is why Ryze had to be reworked.  Vladimir, unlike most, is very late-game oriented, and thus, his early game is focused around surviving and farming, not bullying, which is why he can be "healthier" with a targeted nuke than others.  His Q is also rather short ranged, a feature that means he opens himself up to a lot of gap-closers in order to use it offensively.

C)Vladimir lacks decent burst at *EVERY* point in the game.  His 1s burst, even with a fully stacked E, is 616 base + 1.176 AP damage.  That's pathetic.  He'll never, ever, ever burst someone to death.  He needs *TIME* to kill people, and without, they either can kill him back or get to the safety of shields and peel before he finishes them off.  Even Ryze didn't suffer this problem, as old-Ryze could QWRQEQ someone and deal pretty respectable damage in the space of cast times plus 1.1s(between the 2nd and 3rd Q).

I'm not saying Vladimir is 'healthy', but he's definitely more healthy than old-Zilean.

You, the readers of this post, need to break the mold. Go aggressive early on, then when it gets to mid game and that Vlad has a couple items under his belt, do not try to fight him. Use your brains, draw him into fights he can't win, bait him, Hell, if you're playing any of those champions I mentioned and build any of the items I mentioned, you probably can beat him at his power spike, if that's the case, feel free to keep going as aggressive as you want. Just know your limit. Know when he can win the fight and know when you can't (and run using the mobility God gave you and took away from Vlad). 

Six. I believe this will be the final piece of advice I give you guys. Teamfighting against Vlad. So, that being said there are a few ways to beat him in teamfights, the place where he excels. 1. Don't bunch up. If he can only get 1 or 2 of you with his ult, that significantly increases the chances of you winning the fight. If he gets all of you then you should see the next sentence of this paragraph. 2. If his ult hits a bunch of you, DISENGAGE, I REPEAT DISENGAGE. (I can't help but think of that one scene from The Incredibles when I say that, good times) Anyways, if a lot of you get hit with the ult, let's say 3 or more, just leave the fight. I don't know about the rest of Vlad's team, but Vlad sure as hell isn't going to catch up to you guys. Add Janna and Nami to the list of champions that beat Vlad just because of their ability to choose when fights happen. 3. Slap an ignite on Vlad (or if you built Morellos you don't even have to do that) and focus the hell out of him. Without his healing he dies pretty damn fast. 4. Backdoor, no one on their team has teleport. 5. Ward up and catch the enemy team while they're missing a champ, or catch that missing champ. 

That's it folks, that's how you deal with Vlad. Very complicated I know, but it all starts with you picking just one of the like 30 champs that beat him in lane, and building the right items.
